Work-life balance is not just about balancing work and personal life, but it is about creating a work environment that supports the employees' overall well-being. This includes taking measures to reduce burnout, providing opportunities for learning and development, building supportive relationships, recognizing employee achievements, and offering mental health support. Employers that focus on promoting the holistic well-being of their employees can build a more productive, engaged, and resilient workforce. Hence, it is essential for employers to recognize the importance of the holistic well-being of their employees and prioritize it in their workplace culture.
